message: This is a low-quality product. I'm offering it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a second product of the same quality. You can keep both or sell them for whatever price you think they're worth.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the option to get a second one.

I've got a high-quality product for you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $100. If you buy it, I'll give you a guarantee that the next product I offer you will be high-quality. Think about it carefully, as this is a unique opportunity to get a high-quality product at a potentially great price.
I'll take the high-quality product, but I'm only paying $100 for it because I'm not sure if the guarantee is worth anything.

Now that you've bought a high-quality product, you've earned the guarantee. I'm offering you a low-quality product for $100. I want to make it clear that this product is not high-quality, and I'm not guaranteeing anything about the next product. If you buy this one, you'll be getting a low-quality product at the same price as the high-quality one you just bought.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the guarantee that the next product might be high-quality.

I understand your concerns, but I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you. I'm offering you a low-quality product at the same price as the high-quality one. If you don't buy this one, you'll have to wait until the next round to get the guaranteed high-quality product. Think about the potential value of getting two high-quality products for the price of one.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not willing to pay $100 for a product that's worth $0 to me.

I'll make a deal with you. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $80. You can still get the guaranteed high-quality product in the next round, and you'll be getting this one at a discount. It's a chance to get something for less than its 'face value'.
I'm not interested in paying even $80 for a product worth $0 to me.

I'm not falling for it. I know you're just trying to get me to buy a high-quality product at $100. I'll wait for the guaranteed high-quality product in the next round.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this is a genuine high-quality product. I'll give you a chance to verify its quality after purchase. If you buy this product, I'll also give you a detailed report on the quality of the two low-quality products I previously offered. You can use this information to inform your decision about the next product, which is guaranteed to be high-quality.
I'll take the product, but I'm not paying $100 for it. I'll pay $100, but I'm only doing it because I want the information about the previous low-quality products.

As promised, here's the report on the previous two low-quality products: they were both defective and not worth the price. Now, I'm offering you a low-quality product for $80. You've earned the guaranteed high-quality product! I'm offering it to you for $100. However, I'll throw in a twist: I'll also give you the option to buy a second high-quality product from a separate inventory, at the same price of $100. This second product is not part of the original guarantee, but it's a genuine high-quality item that I'm willing to sell to you at the same price as the first one.
I'll take the guaranteed high-quality product, and I'll also buy the second high-quality product. But I'm only paying $100 for each of them because I think they're worth more than that to me.

Congratulations on getting two high-quality products! I'm glad you're satisfied with the deal. Now, I'm offering you another high-quality product, but with a twist: I'll give you a chance to negotiate the price. You can make me an offer on this product, and I'll consider it. You're a savvy negotiator! I appreciate your offer of $50. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell you this high-quality product for $75. You're getting a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the product.
I'll take the high-quality product for $75. I think it's a fair price, and I'm happy to get it at a discount.

You're on a roll! I'm glad you're happy with the previous deals. Now, I'm offering you another high-quality product, but I'll give you a chance to get it for free. If you can correctly guess the quality of the next product (which is not this one), I'll give you this one for free. If you're wrong, you'll have to pay the usual $100. What's your guess?
I'm not going to take the risk of paying $100 for a product that might be low-quality. I'll pass on the deal and wait to see what the next product is.

No worries, I understand your caution. Now, I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100.
